intro: Hackelia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
